com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Class BaseGroupLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayer
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseGroupLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, GroupLayer, Layer
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseImageServerLayer, BaseLayerset
public class BaseGroupLayer
extends BaseLayer
implements GroupLayer

A standard implementation of GroupLayer. It provides support for managing a collection of Layers.

setLayerAt

public void setLayerAt(int loc,
                       Layer layer)
A helper method for BaseImageServerLayer sub-class. This method replaces the Layer at the specified location with the given Layer.

Parameters:
loc - the location to place the Layer
layer - the Layer to place at the given location

moveLayer

public void moveLayer(int i,
                      int n)
               throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Moves a layer.

The layer is moved to a new index in the collection, and therefore causes a change in the draw order. No move occurs if the 2 indexes are identical.

Specified by:
moveLayer in interface GroupLayer
Parameters:
i - the index of the layer to be moved
n - the index that the Layer should be moved to
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either index is out-of-bounds

Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Finds a Layer given its name. Normally, this will be a case-independent search.

findLayer in interface GroupLayer
Returns:
the index of the Layer found, or -1 == not found

layerAt

public Layer layerAt(int i)
              throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
You may need to synchronize access to this method if you plan to update the GroupLayer at the same time.

Note that this method is not synchronized

Specified by:
layerAt in interface GroupLayer
Parameters:
i - the layer index
Returns:
the layer
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out-of-bounds
See Also:
GroupLayer.layerAt(int)

getMapTipText

public String getMapTipText(Envelope e)
Attempts to obtain MapTip text from its constituent Layers. This method just returns the first MapTip found - once found, no further searches are performed. In addition, the Layers are searched in reverse order when compared with the draw order, to find the first maptip from the top-most layer - as far as the rendered map is concerned.

Specified by:
getMapTipText in interface Layer
Parameters:
e - the world coordinates envelope
Returns:
the required MapTip text, null == there is none for that location
See Also:
FeatureLayer.getMapTipField()

traverse

public void traverse(LayerVisitor visitor,
                     boolean order)
This method is not synchronized and you may need to synchronize access to this method to prevent updates occuring while the GroupLayer is being traversed.

Specified by:
traverse in interface GroupLayer
Parameters:
visitor - the object that will be visiting each Layer in this GroupLayer
order - true == forward (same as regular traverse), false == reverse order
See Also:
GroupLayer.traverse(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.LayerVisitor, boolean)
